de.unisiegen.tpml.core.prettyprinter
Interface PrettyCharIterator

All Superinterfaces:
CharacterIterator, Cloneable
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultPrettyCharIterator
public interface PrettyCharIterator
extends CharacterIterator

Provides functionality to iterate over the characters contained within an PrettyString and extract certain information about the style and annotations for a given character.

Version:
$Rev: 277 $
Author:
Benedikt Meurer
See Also:
PrettyAnnotation, PrettyString, PrettyStyle

Field Summary
 
Fields inherited from interface java.text.CharacterIterator
DONE
 
Method Summary
 PrettyAnnotation getAnnotation()
          Returns the most significant PrettyAnnotation for the current character.
 PrettyStyle getStyle()
          Returns the PrettyStyle, which should be used for the current character, or PrettyStyle.NONE if no special highlighting should be applied to the current character.
 
Methods inherited from interface java.text.CharacterIterator
clone, current, first, getBeginIndex, getEndIndex, getIndex, last, next, previous, setIndex
 

Method Detail

getAnnotation

PrettyAnnotation getAnnotation()
Returns the most significant PrettyAnnotation for the current character.

Returns:
the most significant annotation for the current character.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if the current index is outside the string bounds. This holds if the character iterator points to the end index.
See Also:
CharacterIterator.getIndex()

getStyle

PrettyStyle getStyle()
Returns the PrettyStyle, which should be used for the current character, or PrettyStyle.NONE if no special highlighting should be applied to the current character.

Returns:
the PrettyStyle for the current character.
See Also:
CharacterIterator.getIndex()
